oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1958-12-06 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from December 6, 1958. This show celebrates the 1000th network broadcast of the Prince Albert Grand Ole Opry, featuring Grant Turner (announcer), and performances by Bill Monroe and his Blue Grass Boys, Pee Wee King with Tommy Jackson, the Fruit Jar Drinkers, Chet Atkins, Minnie Pearl, the Old Hickory Singers, and Marty Robbins. Also features recorded messages from Roy Acuff, Red Foley, and Tennessee Ernie Ford, and an excerpt of a Hank Williams recording. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Bill Monroe; Blue Grass Boys; Pee Wee King; Fruit Jar Drinkers; Hank Williams
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces the Opry cast -- Stay A Little Longer (cast) -- Grant Turner talks about the history of the Opry -- Grant Turner introduces Bill Monroe and his Blue Grass Boys -- John Henry (Bill Monroe and his Blue Grass Boys) -- Grant Turner talks about the history of the Opry -- Grant Turner introduces Roy Acuff -- Roy Acuff talks (recording) -- Grant Turner introduces Pee Wee King -- Bonaparte's Retreat (Pee Wee King) -- Prince Albert commercial (Pee Wee King, Grant Turner) -- Grant Turner introduces the Fruit Jar Drinkers -- Bill Cheatham (Fruit Jar Drinkers) -- Pee Wee King and Grant Turner talk about the history of the Opry -- Red Foley talks (recording) -- Pee Wee King introduces a Hank Williams recording -- I'm So Lonesome I Could Cry (Hank Williams) (recording, excerpt) -- Grant Turner talks about the history of the Opry -- [Unidentified fiddle tune] (excerpt, test band)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); United States.
